inkscape-extension.name: Force lock stitches
inkscape-extension.label: Small fonts will sometimes unravel if threads are cut after the embroidery machine has finished the work. Therefore it is important that also diacritics with a smaller distance to the font body than defined by the collapse length value (default: 3mm) have lock stitches. This can be achieved by adding a forced lock stitch attribute to them.
This extension has been build to help font authors to define "force lock stitches"-attributes automatically if they are placed in a predefined distance to the next object.

param.name: last_element
param.gui-text: Add force lock stitches attribute to the last element of each glyph
